Row.Text: Welcome, fair stranger, to the protected harbors of Carthage. I am known as Dido, the wanderer of Tyre.
The Queen of Carthage welcomes you to her fair city. While many know me as Elissa, you may call me Dido.
The Phoenicians welcome you to our fair nation. I am Dido, Queen of Carthage and all her holdings.
Ugh. I expected so much more from you.
A good move, but perhaps not good enough.
How foolish of you.
My sword is true, and mighty as any hero's. I hope you've learned your lesson, and to Carthage come no more.
Ring the bells, fly high the standard upon the Byrsa. My fair nation is adorned in victory - what say of yours?
What witchery have you employed, what foul charm have you evoked against my army? I shall be wary of you, next time.
I must have angered the fates, it is the only explanation. No one like you could ever hope to defeat me, unless you were aided by others from above.
To Fate I sue, for now I see all the heavens and earth conspire against me. Fate, the only refuge, the only counsel left.
When I am laid to finally rest in earth, may I be remembered, even as my poor city is consumed in fire and torment.
A pyre I think, one befitting of a goddess. Its flames shall lick across the water's edge, dancing in concert with the stars above. Death is now my welcome guest.
Well met.
Greetings.
Until we meet again.
Goodbye.
Very well.
I commend you on what you're trying to do, but you'll have to be better than this. Come, try again.
Can you do a little better?
That's not quite good enough.
Almost...
I am not interested.
Whatever will you do with this? I am intrigued by this bizarre notion, and would like to see it through.
What a silly person you are! You can't ever get something for nothing, not in this court.
Come, let us play a game. Perhaps I'll even let you win.
Yes, I believe your gold shall do nicely for this! Come now, hand it over.
All right.
Very Well.
I must refuse.
No.
Let's hear it.
Go ahead.
Welcome.
It's good to see you again.
Farewell.
Goodbye.
Agreed.
Why, I wouldn't even let dear Aeneas get away with such an offer. Why don't you try that again, hmm?
Is that the best you can do?
You're almost there...
Thank you, but no.
Hrm... well, I suppose it wouldn't hurt this one time. Take it quickly, lest my advisors find out.
That's completely out of the question - what have you been drinking today?
I just had the marvelous idea, and I think you'll appreciate it too.
I just had the marvelous idea, and I think you'll appreciate it too.
Excellent.
Certainly not.
We decline.
Proceed.
I'm listening.
Well?
What do you want now?
That is all.
Go away.
Fine. Agreed.
I really don't see where this is going. Stop sputtering and make a real offer already.
That's not good enough.
You must do better than that.
Almost...
You think to best me? ME, who outwitted Pygmalion and the lords of Tyre? Ugh, you disgust me.
In the interest of returning to more pressing matters in a timely fashion, I'll agree to this ridiculousness.
You're no better than Iarbas, and by far his lesser in many ways. Shall I count them? Oh stay, I believe you will find this educational.
A fool's errand I'm sure, but I can at least say I tried - which is better than I can say of others in this room.
These things I do require, and I grow tired of listening to your pathetic attempts at witty discourse.
I suppose I must.
I beg your pardon?
That's unacceptable.
You cannot be serious!
And?
Peace and I are strangers grown; I can no longer abide the terrors you wreak upon this land. Prepare, destiny comes for you tonight.
Fate, it seems, has it out for you. Fair Carthage's ire have you aroused in your mockery and measures. Your time has come.
Tell me - do you know how my army numbers, my trains of elephant or fleets of ship? No? Well, you'll soon find out.
Oh foul, treacherous man! No repentance shall reclaim mine injured self - your acts bring ill between our peoples forever more.
What do you hope to gain from such a wretched act? My elephants will realign your senses for you, free of charge.
With deceit you've come to my harbor - the hypocrite, the serpent. With the gods as my witnesses, you shall repay your debt in blood and toil.
